alert1: The chosen pole is not in the dictionary ...
tip_lecteur: click on a word: read audio file
specifMot: The specific words of the part:
alert2: ... please select at least one facet ...
alert3: Enter a pole to start the calculation ...
interface1:
- to explore Naija data via "classic" textometric operations: concordance, specificities, etc.

- to explore Naija data from a sociolinguistic perspective
interface_exp1:
apart from the functions presented in normal mode, expert mode also makes it possible

- to explore dependency relations in the Naija corpus.

- to calculate the co-occurrences of a given pole word

- to search the dependent list of a given lemma
quest_content:
Once the base is loaded, you will find on the left a series of buttons to define your choices.

Click on the buttons and choose a criteria by facet. i.e. SEX: F, AGE: < 15 if you want to observe the word specificity for under-15-year-old girls.

Then click the Specificities Selected Part button at the bottom to generate the result of your choices.
lecture_content1: You will see a word cloud in which higher statistical salience is represented by larger font size.
lecture_content2: Click on a word, you will find the terms displayed with contexts in a concordancer.
audio_content: Please click on a term in the table to listen to the pronunciation of this term or possibly the full dialogue / monologue.
specif_content: In expert mode, you will find partition buttons which allow you to update a table showing for all the words with their frequency and their specificity index on all the parts induced by the selected partition.
rel_content: By taking as input the name of a relation as object , we display for this relation the lemma governor and its dependent in POS.
rel_content2: Click on the icon below to display the word in context in a concordancer. You will then see a concordance of the target couple (the governor is the pole of the concordance and its dependent is highlighted in yellow)
rel_content3:
The ANY relation makes it possible to designate all the relations potentially associated with a given governor. The result is similar to that which we obtained until now but this time we are only interested in the targeted governor and we extract all its relations from Dependencies.

The Contexts ++ button displays the prototypical contexts extracted from all of these relationships.
dep_content: Based on the functionality Quest-Dependency relation , we can then for a given lemma (with regard to the associated POS) search for the list of its dependents (in lemma).
cooc_content: Enter a pole word then click on the Cooccurrent button to display a graph of cooccurrents of the given pole (with return to context).
